intro: Rubus idaeus subsp. vulgatus, commonly known as the common blackberry, is a shrub native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its thorny stems, compound leaves, and aggregate fruits that develop from multiple ovaria. The plant produces dark purple to black berries that are rich in antioxidants and have a sweet-tart flavor. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. This subspecies is widely cultivated for both its fruit and ornamental value.
